content: Yes, while it is not recommended by traditional cast iron pan enthusiasts, you can use a small amount of soap on your cast iron pan to clean it, and then re-season as needed to restore its nonstick and rust-resistant properties. When using soap, make sure to rinse the pan thoroughly to remove any soap residue before drying and re-seasoning. Keep in mind that using soap may require more frequent re-seasoning of your cast iron pan.
